attributes.comment:
I am writing in regard to the proposed increase in fees for the I-600A. My
youngest child is adopted, and the expense of adoption is high which limits many
would be parents who would raise productive and loyal American citizens in their
ability to adopt. Unfortunately, for those of us who are currently persuing an
adoption from China, this form has to be filed twice because the referral times are
taking so long at this time. In refiling this form, most adoptive parents also have
to update their homestudies including criminal records checks and various other
costly documents further increasing their fees. At this time I think an increase in
this fee would unfairly penalize those parents caught in a long wait that is out of
their control by requiring great additional expense. Adoption is expensive, and
many parents walk into parenting an adoptive child with loans they wouldn't
otherwise have and then have the increased expense of child care and medical
tests and procedures. Anything that can be done to keep these expenses down
is most appreciated in this special community.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Tamara Page
